TO: NAEB BOARD OF DIRE
Item No, 3
12-17-54
From: Frank E, Bchooley
Re: Radio Grants-in-Aid for 1955-56o
President Harry Newburn, of the Center* has advised Skornia
that the Center Board of Directors lias authorized placing in the
Center budget the sum of $42.<,000, to carry on the Grant-in-Aid
program. This amount would include $2$000 overhead designed to
take care of NAEBfs expenses and administrative costs.
The letter contains the following paragraph:
t?The Board of Directors made one suggestion with which our staff
concurs. They felt that there should be some design*, plan or
possibly theme operating in the assignment of these grants
and directing in‘some measure the general nature of the content
for which such support will be given. It is necessary, there¬
fore, for me to suggest that in connection with planning for
the grants this year procedures be developed to insure that
some°such pattern is made available. This, the Board felt,
v/ould tend to place some limitations upon the nature of the
program content for which the Center would make grants on
the recommendation of the NAEB and thus concentrate a little
more about some significant program needs in the offering,.
While the Center has no desire to dictate the nature of this
patterns we do wish to encourage its development,”
1 recommend approval.
